title: Dharan Infra-EPC to expand into renewable energy segment

-Get businessline apps on Connect with us TO ENJOY ADDITIONAL BENEFITS
-Infrastructure company Dharan Infra-EPC Ltd on Saturday said it will set up a wholly-owned subsidiary to expand into the solar energy and renewable power segment. The new subsidiary, Dharan Infra Solar Pvt Ltd, will operate in the solar power and renewable energy sector and undertake design, development, and execution of solar modules and hybrid energy systems, the company said in an exchange filing. Dharan Infra Solar will engage in a wide spectrum of activities, including the manufacturing, design, development, and improvement of renewable energy modules, cells, and accessories. The new subsidiary also aims to provide end-to-end solutions for solar power projects, the filing stated. The strategic move is aimed

3. Drug major Sun Pharma on Saturday said the US health regulator has issued a Form 483 with 8 observations after inspecting its Halol (Gujarat) manufacturing plant. The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) conducted a good manufacturing practices (GMP) inspection at the Halol facility from June 2-13 2025, the Mumbai-based drug maker said in a regulatory filing. title: Ensuring passenger safety the foremost priority: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran
summary:
1. Summarize this article into 5 bullet points and 3 CXO insights:
-573.38 -169.60 + 353.00 + 1,768.00 + 366.00 + 353.00
2. Ensure passenger safety was the first and foremost priority for Tata group, which took over Air India in 2022, Chairman N Chandrasekaran said in a staff message on Friday.
3. The Tata group is trying to understand what caused the crash.
4. Patience is a matter of speculation, and the probable causes of the accident continue to be a matter of speculation.
5. Ensuring passenger safety was the first and foremost priority for Tata group, according to Chairman N Chandrasekaran.
6. The Tata group is trying to understand what caused the crash and will be communicating their findings to the families and loved ones affected.
7. The Tata group is committed to helping the families and loved ones of those who suffered from the incident.
8. The Tata group is looking to provide full transparency in the investigation of the crash.
9. The Tata group will be communicating their findings to all stakeholders once they have checked all possible facts.

Title: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) Acquires BizSum For $1.2bn To Expand Its Digital Offerings
Abstract: The acquisition will create the world's largest BPO services company with more than 370,000 employees, leading in customer experience, application development, digital transformation, data analytics, cybersecurity and cloud services.
Introduction:
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has acquired BizSum, a leading business process outsourcing (BPO) provider, for $1.2 billion. This acquisition will create the world's largest BPO services company, with more than 370,000 employees. TCS will use BizSum's technology, talent, and delivery capabilities to expand its digital offerings and enhance its customer experience, application development, digital transformation, data analytics, cybersecurity, and cloud services.
Brief overview:
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is one of the world's largest information technology (IT) and business process management (BPM) services and solutions provider. The company has a diverse customer base across various industries, including financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, retail, and government.
The acquisition of BizSum will create TCS's largest BPO services company with

[Subtitle]
Exploring the future of digital banking
[Bullet 1]
The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the shift towards digital banking, with more customers opting for online transactions and digital banking services.
[Bullet 2]
Here’s how digital banking is set to transform the banking industry in the future.
[Bullet 3]
1. Increased convenience: Digital banking provides customers with a range of convenient features, including 24/7 access to accounts, mobile banking, and real-time account balances.
[Bullet 4]
2. Improved security: Digital banking offers security features such as two-factor authentication and biometric authentication, which protect customer data.
[Bullet 5]
3. Enhanced customer experience: Digital banking allows customers to access banking services wherever they are, providing a more personalized and convenient experience.
[Subtitle]
Beyond the pandemic: The future of digital banking
[Bullet 1]
The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the shift towards digital banking, but it’s not the only factor driving this trend.
[Bullet 2]
